remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Hello, thank you for coming in today. I understand you’ve experienced ulcers in your mouth and increasing soreness in your left cheek. To help guide my assessment, can you describe in more detail how the soreness in your left cheek has changed over time and if you’ve noticed any new or worsening symptoms?

remedi_labels.value: change in soreness in left cheek over time

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um, hi. Yeah, the main thing is that the pain in my left cheek has been getting worse. It started out just kind of sore, but now it’s more painful, especially around where the ulcer is. I’m just, uh, worried about how much it hurts lately.

I can understand why you’d be worried, especially with the pain in your left cheek getting worse and the persistent ulcer. To help guide my assessment, can you tell me if you’ve noticed any swelling, changes in the appearance of the ulcer, or difficulty eating or speaking due to these symptoms?

remedi_labels.value: changes in appearance of the ulcer

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Well, um... the swelling has definitely gotten worse, I think. And, actually, I’ve started having some chest pain too, which is making me a bit more anxious. Should I be worried about that?

remedi_labels.value: Should I be worried about that?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious, especially with both worsening swelling in your cheek and new chest pain. To help guide my assessment, can you describe the chest pain in more detail—such as when it started, how severe it is, and whether it’s associated with symptoms like shortness of breath or palpitations?

remedi_labels.value: chest pain details (onset, severity, associated symptoms such as shortness of breath or palpitations)

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Um, let me think... The chest pain started a couple days ago. It’s not super sharp, but it’s kind of a pressure, and it comes and goes. I’ve also noticed some shortness of breath when it happens, which is making me more anxious. 

And, uh, I guess another thing—when I take the narcotic pain medications, I get pretty constipated. I’m not sure if that’s related, but it’s been a problem too.

I can understand why you’d feel anxious with these new symptoms, especially the chest pain and shortness of breath. To help guide my assessment, have you experienced any fever, chills, or discharge from the area of the oral ulcer or your surgical incision, which could suggest an infection complicating your current condition?

remedi_labels.value: discharge from the area of the oral ulcer

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um, actually, yeah—I have had some shaking chills and a fever over 101.5 the last day or so. There’s also been some discharge from the incision, and it looks more red and swollen than before. The ulcers in my mouth and the painness in my left cheek just seem to be getting worse, too. I’m honestly pretty anxious about all of this.

I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious, especially with the worsening pain, swelling, fever, and discharge you’ve described. To help guide my assessment, have you noticed any difficulty opening your mouth fully or any changes in your ability to swallow since these symptoms have progressed?

Um, yeah, actually—it’s been harder to open my mouth all the way lately. Swallowing is a bit more difficult too, especially when the painness and swelling get worse. And like I mentioned, I’ve had shaking chills and a fever over 101.5 the past day or so. I just… I’m not sure if all of this together is something serious, but it’s making me pretty anxious.

I can understand why you’d be worried, especially with the combination of pain, swelling, fever, and difficulty opening your mouth. To help guide my assessment, have you noticed any numbness or tingling in your cheek or jaw area, or any changes in sensation since these symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: numbness or tingling in cheek or jaw area

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Yeah, actually, now that you mention it, I have noticed a little bit of numbness in my left cheek—kind of a tingling feeling sometimes. It’s not constant, but it’s definitely new since all these symptoms started. 

Also, the incision looks more red and swollen than before, and there’s some discharge coming from it. I’m just not sure if that means it’s infected or if this is normal healing. Should I be worried about the increased redness and swelling from the incision?

remedi_labels.value: incision looks more red and swollen
whether increased redness and swelling means infection or normal healing

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried about the increased redness, swelling, and discharge from your incision, especially with your other symptoms. To help guide my assessment, have you noticed any foul odor from the incision site or any spreading redness beyond the immediate area, which could indicate a more significant infection?

remedi_labels.value: increased redness, swelling, and discharge from incision

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Um, let me think... Yeah, I have noticed a bit of a foul odor coming from the incision, and the redness seems to be spreading out a little past where it was before. The discharge from the incision is kind of yellowish now. 

I’m honestly getting more worried, especially with the fever and chills on top of everything else. Is this something that could be a serious infection? Should I be doing something different, or do I need antibiotics?

remedi_labels.value: should I be doing something different

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be anxious, especially with the spreading redness, foul odor, and yellowish discharge from your incision along with your other symptoms. To help guide my assessment, have you noticed any swelling or tenderness in the lymph nodes around your neck or jaw since these symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: swelling or tenderness in the lymph nodes around neck or jaw

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Yeah, actually—I have noticed some swelling and tenderness in the lymph nodes around my jaw and neck. It feels kind of sore when I touch that area, and I think the swelling has gotten worse as all these other symptoms have been happening.

With everything going on—the fever, chills, discharge, and now the lymph node swelling—I’m just really anxious. Is this something that needs to be treated right away? Could this infection spread or get more serious if we don’t do something soon?

remedi_labels.value: swelling and tenderness in the lymph nodes around jaw and neck
soreness when touching lymph node area
Is this something that needs to be treated right away?
Could this infection spread or get more serious if we don’t do something soon?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried, especially with the combination of fever, chills, spreading redness, discharge with foul odor, and swelling of your lymph nodes—these symptoms suggest a significant infection that could become serious if not addressed promptly. Based on your description, I’m concerned about the possibility of a deep tissue or surgical site infection that may require urgent medical assessment and likely antibiotic therapy. Have you experienced any difficulty breathing, rapid heartbeat, or confusion in addition to your current symptoms?

remedi_labels.value: deep tissue or surgical site infection

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Yeah, I have had some shortness of breath, especially when the chest pain happens. My heart does feel like it’s beating faster sometimes, but I haven’t really felt confused—just more anxious and kind of shaky when the fever gets high.

I’m honestly pretty worried now that you’re saying this could be a deep tissue or surgical site infection. Should I go to the hospital right away? Is this something that could get dangerous quickly if I wait? And, um, what kind of antibiotics would I need for something like this?

remedi_labels.value: Should I go to the hospital right away
Is this something that could get dangerous quickly if I wait
what kind of antibiotics would I need

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be anxious, given your symptoms of persistent mouth ulcers, worsening left cheek pain and swelling, fever, chills, spreading redness and discharge from your incision, and now lymph node tenderness and shortness of breath. These findings are concerning for a significant infection that may require urgent medical assessment and intervention. To further guide my assessment, have you had any recent blood diagnostic evaluations or imaging studies since these symptoms began that could help evaluate the extent of the infection or your overall condition?

remedi_labels.value: worsening left cheek pain and swelling
spreading redness and discharge from incision
recent blood diagnostic evaluations or imaging studies

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Um, let me think... No, I haven’t had any recent blood work or imaging since these symptoms started getting worse. The last time I had blood tests was before my last round of chemo, but that was a while ago—definitely before all this new swelling, fever, and discharge from the incision.

Should I be getting blood diagnostics or maybe a scan now to see how bad the infection is? And, um, if it’s as serious as it sounds, would I need to be admitted to the hospital for IV antibiotics or anything like that? I’m just really anxious about how quickly this could get worse.

remedi_labels.value: no recent blood work or imaging
last blood tests before last round of chemo
blood diagnostics or scan to assess infection

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be anxious, given your symptoms of fever, chills, worsening swelling, discharge with odor, and lymph node tenderness—all of which suggest a significant infection that may require urgent intervention. Based on your current symptoms and the lack of recent blood diagnostics or imaging, I strongly recommend prompt hospital assessment so we can perform a thorough examination, obtain blood cultures, and possibly imaging to determine the extent of the infection. Before you go in, have you noticed any new or rapidly worsening symptoms such as severe difficulty breathing, persistent confusion, or inability to keep fluids down?

Um, let me think... I haven’t had severe difficulty breathing—just that shortness of breath when the chest pain happens, but I can still breathe okay most of the time. I haven’t felt confused, just really anxious and shaky when my fever goes up. I’m able to keep fluids down, but it’s been harder to eat because of the mouth ulcers and the pain in my left cheek.

I guess I’m just worried about how quickly all these symptoms have gotten worse—especially the fever, chills, and the discharge with odor from the incision. Is there anything I should do right now before heading to the hospital? And, um, should I bring all my current medications with me? I just want to make sure I’m doing everything right.

remedi_labels.value: shortness of breath when chest pain happens
anxious and shaky when fever goes up
discharge with odor from the incision
Is there anything I should do right now before heading to the hospital?
should I bring all my current medications with me?
